thread.title: Bengaluru: Heavy Rain Leads to Water Leakage at Airport; 17 Flights Diverted to Chennai | Times Now
thread.title_full: Bengaluru: Heavy Rain Leads to Water Leakage at Airport; 17 Flights Diverted to Chennai | Times Now

author: Deepak Bopanna
title: Bengaluru: Heavy Rain Leads to Water Leakage at Airport; 17 Flights Diverted to Chennai | Times Now
text: Bengaluru: Heavy and intense rainfall in Bengaluru on Thursday night lead to water leakage in certain parts of terminals at Kempegowda International Airport (KIA). Meanwhile, due to the bad weather, several flights were diverted from the city. According to a BIAL (Bangalore International Airport Limited) spokesperson, as many as 13 domestic flights, three international passenger flights, and one international cargo flight were diverted to Chennai. A video of the water leak at the airport has also surfaced.See Video HereBangalore airport water leak "A very heavy downpour of rain within a short span of time on the evening of May 9, 2024, resulted in water leakage in certain areas of the terminals at BLR Airport. Heavy rainfall accompanied by strong winds, between 21:35 hrs. and 22:29 hrs, led to the diversion of flights. 13 domestic flights, 03 international passenger flights, and 01 international cargo flight were diverted to Chennai," a BIAL spokesperson said. He further added, "Our teams promptly responded to the situation to mitigate the impact and restore normal operations. We regret the inconvenience caused to our passengers"
